predictions.text: Finland’s National Bureau of Investigation (NBI) or Finnish prosecutors will publicly announce criminal suspicion/charges (e.g., sabotage or aggravated criminal damage) against a named vessel and/or at least one crew member in connection with the Dec 2025 Finland–Estonia undersea cable damage, by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: NBI/prosecutor press release or official statement naming the case as criminal and naming the vessel and/or at least one suspect/accused individual, explicitly tied to the Dec 2025 cable incident.
monitoring_signals: NBI or Finnish prosecutor press briefings on the cable case
Finnish court filings regarding detention/seizure orders for the vessel
Estonian/Finnish transport or telecom authority incident updates
predictions.rationale: A detention already occurred; follow-on criminal process (publicly naming suspects/charges) is a plausible next step but not assured.

predictions.text: NATO will announce a new Baltic Sea maritime operation or task force explicitly focused on protecting undersea critical infrastructure (cables/pipelines), with a named operation/initiative and participating allies, by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: NATO (HQ, SACEUR, or NATO Maritime Command) publishes an announcement that explicitly frames the initiative as Baltic Sea undersea critical-infrastructure protection and includes a named operation/initiative and at least 2 participating member states.
monitoring_signals: NATO press releases and North Atlantic Council statements
MARCOM announcements and force posture updates
Baltic Sea ally defense-ministry communiques mentioning cable protection
predictions.rationale: Repeated cable incidents raise the odds of a formal NATO-branded response beyond ad hoc national patrols.

predictions.text: At least one U.S. state public utility commission will open a formal docket/rulemaking specifically addressing data-center load growth (or creating a new large-load tariff class) that explicitly mentions AI/data centers as the driver, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: PUC commission order/notice opening a docket or rulemaking in any U.S. state where the purpose statement explicitly cites AI data centers/data-center load and addresses tariffs, interconnection, cost allocation, or reliability planning for that load.
monitoring_signals: PUC agenda items and new docket postings in VA, GA, NC, OH, TX, AZ
Utility IRPs and special contract filings for large-load customers
State legislative hearings referencing data-center electricity impacts
predictions.rationale: Political backlash and rapid load forecasts make a formal regulatory proceeding likely within 6 months in at least one state.

predictions.text: At least one major European bank (HSBC, Santander, BNP Paribas, SocGen, Deutsche Bank, Barclays, UBS, UniCredit, or ING) will announce a restructuring plan that includes at least 7,500 net job cuts (or planned role eliminations) and explicitly cites AI/automation/digitalization as a driver, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Company press release, earnings materials, or a Reuters/Bloomberg report quoting the bank that specifies ≥7,500 job cuts/role eliminations and explicitly links the action to AI/automation/digitalization.
monitoring_signals: Bank earnings calls and investor-day presentations
Union consultations/works council notices in major EU jurisdictions
Reuters/Bloomberg restructuring scoops citing headcount figures
predictions.rationale: If large sector-wide cuts are real, at least one flagship bank should crystallize plans into a measurable announcement in 2026.

predictions.text: The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) will leave its monetary policy settings unchanged (no re-centering or slope change) at its next scheduled policy decision in 2026 H1, by 2026-04-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: MAS monetary policy statement indicating no change to the S$NEER policy band parameters (slope, width, or level/re-centering) at the relevant scheduled review in 2026 H1.
monitoring_signals: MAS policy statement calendar and pre-meeting economist surveys
Singapore CPI core inflation prints and GDP revisions
S$NEER commentary and MAS speeches
predictions.rationale: Strong growth alone doesn’t force tightening if inflation is manageable; MAS often prefers holding settings steady absent a clear inflation surprise.

predictions.text: A bill will be introduced in the U.S. Congress to permanently exclude discharged/forgiven student-loan balances from federal taxable income (i.e., making student-loan forgiveness tax-free beyond temporary provisions), by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Congress.gov shows a newly introduced bill in the House or Senate that amends the Internal Revenue Code to exclude student-loan forgiveness/discharge from gross income (permanent or with an end date beyond 2028).
monitoring_signals: Congress.gov keyword alerts (student loan, 1099-C, gross income, IRC 108)
Press releases from Senate Finance/House Ways & Means members
Advocacy group legislative trackers (NASFAA, Student Borrower Protection Center)
predictions.rationale: A renewed ‘tax bomb’ increases political pressure for a legislative fix, making bill introduction more likely than passage.

predictions.text: CMS (or HHS) will issue a proposed rule or formal Medicare policy guidance that would expand or clarify Medicare Part D coverage pathways for FDA-approved anti-obesity drugs (GLP-1s) for weight loss (not solely diabetes), by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A CMS/HHS proposed rule in the Federal Register or an official CMS guidance document explicitly addressing Medicare coverage for anti-obesity pharmacotherapy for weight loss (beyond diabetes-only indications).
monitoring_signals: Federal Register: CMS Part D and coverage rulemaking
CMS HPMS memos to Part D sponsors
HHS/CMS press briefings and legislative proposals tied to obesity treatment
predictions.rationale: GLP-1 budget impact is large, but competitive and public-health pressure could push CMS toward a formal proposal even if finalization is uncertain.

predictions.text: BYD will announce China-wide MSRP reductions (or new lower-priced trims positioned as price cuts) of at least 5% on at least 3 distinct passenger-vehicle models in a single coordinated announcement, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: BYD press release/official channels or a Reuters/Bloomberg report citing BYD that lists ≥3 models with new MSRPs at least 5% below prior published MSRPs, characterized as a pricing action in China.
monitoring_signals: BYD official Weibo/website model pricing updates
China auto-industry media tracking transaction price changes
Reuters/Bloomberg reporting on EV price wars
predictions.rationale: High volumes and intense competition make periodic broad-based price actions plausible, especially if demand softens or rivals discount.

predictions.text: The Nasdaq Composite will close at least 15% below its highest close of 2026 at least once, by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Using official Nasdaq Composite closing values: there exists a trading day on or before 2026-09-30 where the close is ≤ 0.85 × (maximum closing level achieved in 2026 up to that point).
monitoring_signals: Nasdaq 100/Nasdaq Composite peak-to-trough drawdown tracking
AI megacap earnings revisions and guidance
Financial conditions (credit spreads, rate expectations) and equity breadth
predictions.rationale: Valuation-concentration concerns raise drawdown odds, but a 15% move is common enough that confidence is moderate.
